When Schneizel is placed under Lelouch`s control, Diethard flies into a rage, holding Lelouch at gunpoint and claiming that Zero`s story is dead. Schneizel shoots him in the heart before he can pull the trigger. In his dying moments, Diethard asks Lelouch to use his Geass to kill him, to which Lelouch responds that Diethard isn`t worthy of having a Geass order cast upon him.

character.name: Lloyd Asplund
character.description: Lloyd Asplund is an earl of the Britannian nobility and the head of the scientific research team Camelot, which is responsible for the development of the elite Knightmare Frame Lancelot. To keep from being reminded of the fragility of human lives and friendship, Lloyd immerses himself in science and comes to view people as nothing more than tools — he regards Suzaku, for example, as a mere component of the machine that he pilots. He has a tendency to mock others and is often rebuked for this behavior by Cécile Croomy, his assistant. Prior to joining the military, he attended the Imperial Colchester Institute.[4] Lloyd`s research organization, Camelot (キャメロット?), is an irregular division of the Britannian Military that has permission from Prince Schneizel to operate outside the command structure and regulations of the regular Britannian armed forces. Rakshata refers to Lloyd as the Earl of Pudding (プリン伯爵?), as pudding is his favorite food. He is engaged to Milly Ashford in the first season, having agreed to the union mostly in the hope that he might obtain the designs of the Knightmare Frame Ganymede. As such, he is forced into doing nice things for her by Suzaku, though Milly breaks off the engagement after she graduates in order to become more true to herself. After the second battle of Tokyo, he is confronted by a distraught Nina after she realizes the fatalities caused by her F.L.E.I.J.A. Lloyd tells her that she has to make a choice between saving her heart and morals or discard them for science. When asked by Nina if he had already made that choice, he replies that he never had such a problem due to himself being a sociopath. He willingly joins Lelouch`s new regime, remarking that he and Cécile have become "parts" without ever realizing it. He and Cecile are among the few who know the details of the "Zero Requiem", Lelouch`s plan to unite the world. He expresses an interest in studying Lelouch`s Geass, but he is warned off by Jeremiah. He works with Nina and Cécile to create a countermeasure to F.L.E.I.J.A. and assists Sayoko during the rescue of the hostages on board the Avalon (as ordered by Lelouch). He and Cécile are last seen in Ohgi and Villetta`s wedding picture.

character.name: Lancelot
character.description: The Lancelot is the first seventh-generation Knightmare Frame, an experimental prototype developed by Lloyd Asplund. It is the personal Knightmare Frame of the Knight of Seven Kururugi Suzaku.

character.name: Gawain
character.description: The Gawain is a sixth-generation prototype Knightmare Frame developed by Schneizel el Britannia, and is about twice the size of other Knightmare Frames. It is the first Knightmare Frame in the series to feature an integrated float system thus being capable of sustained flight, and features a double-seater cockpit, although it can be operated by a single person. Its fingers are miniature Slash Harkens, and its Hadron Cannons, especially after Rakshata Chawla`s modifications, are devastating long-range weapons. The Gefjun Disturber installed by Rakshata also has the side effect of making the Gawain invisible to radar. The prototype Druid System installed on the Gawain, originally intended to study the Thought Elevators, gives the it the ability to plot the probable movements of enemy units. Despite its rather impressive firepower, it is a comparatively slow unit, and can be easily outpaced by faster Knightmare Frames such as Gloucesters. The Gawain was stolen by Lelouch and Kallen from Schneizel`s expeditionary force during the incident at Kaminejima island, and later became Lelouch and C.C.`s personal Knightmare Frame. The Gawain was destroyed when C.C. entangled Jeremiah Gottwald`s Siegfried and sent both of them to the bottom of the ocean. The Hadron Cannons were salvaged and incorporated into the Ikaruga, the Black Knights` flagship, as was the Druid System, which later became a key part of Lelouch`s second personal Knightmare Frame, the Shinkirou.

character.name: Shinsei Britannia Teikoku
character.description: The Holy Britannian Empire is an imperial monarchy and the most prominent superpower in the Code Geass universe. At the start of the series it controls well over one-third of the world: the entire Western Hemisphere (both American continents) as well as colonies known as "Areas" around the world, such as Japan (Area 11). This organization entry is intended to cover only people who are part of the Britannian Empire in an official capacity, such as members of the nobility or imperial family or the military.

character.name: Marianne vi Britannia
character.description: Marianne vi Britannia is the fifth wife of the Emperor of Britannia and the mother of Lelouch and Nunnally, titled the 98th Empress of the Holy Britannian Empire. She is nicknamed "Marianne the Flash" for her piloting skills, having been the test pilot for the Ganymede Knightmare Frame with the support of the Ashford Foundation, which was then a contender in the development of the first Knightmare Frame prototypes. Bismarck Waldstein claims that the only person he had to use his Geass against before Suzaku was Marianne, which shows that she must have been particularly skilled. When Lelouch was a child, she was assassinated within the Aries Palace, purportedly by terrorists, and the culprits were never found. The fact that the impenetrable security of the palace was powerless is what convinced Lelouch that her murder was no random act of terrorism.

character.name: Ashford Gakuen
character.description: The Ashford Academy is a Britannian private academy in Tokyo, owned and operated by the Ashford Foundation. It is attended by Lelouch and Nunnally, who, owing to their mother`s relationship with the Foundation, have been granted free residence in the campus` student club house.

character.name: Avalon
character.description: The Avalon is one of the primary flagships used by the Britannian side throughout the series.

character.name: Mrs. Stadtfeld
character.description: Mrs. Stadtfeld is the second wife of Mr. Stadtfeld, Kallen`s and Naoto Kōzuki`s father. [spoiler="History"]Since she could not bear any children of her own, Mrs. Stadtfeld accepted her husband`s proposal to adopt his daughter Kallen as his heir. Though Mrs. Stadtfeld ordered Kallen`s biological mother never to see her daughter again, Kallen`s mother refused and managed to persuade the Stadtfelds to hire her as a maid in their house so she could remain close to Kallen. However, Mrs. Stadtfeld is openly abusive towards Kallen`s mother, often hitting Kallen`s mother whenever any of the servants in the household make a mistake.[/spoiler] (source: fandom.com)

episode.title: 魔神が生まれた日
The Day a New Demon Was Born
Der Tag, an dem ein neuer Dämon geboren wurde
Naissance du Dieu maléfique
Il giorno in cui nacque il demonio
O dia em que o deus maligno nasceu
Diena, Kai Demonas Gimė
วันที่จอมมารถือกำเนิด
Majin ga Umareta Hi
episode.summary: Lelouch Lamperouge finds himself caught in a clash between an anti-government terrorist group and the Britannian army. When things take a turn from bad to worse, a mysterious green-haired girl bestows a dangerous power upon him, changing his life forever. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 覚醒の白き騎士
The White Knight Awakens
Das Erwachen des weißen Ritters
L`éveil du Chevalier Blanc
Il Risveglio Del cavaliere Bianco
O despertar do cavaleiro branco
Baltojo Riterio Prabudimas
อัศวินสีขาวตื่นจากนิทรา
Kakusei no Shiroki Kishi
episode.summary: Lelouch teams up with the terrorist group to take down the army as they destroy Shinjuku Ghetto. But when Suzaku is put in control of the army’s newest Knightmare model, will Lelouch’s plan fall apart? Or can he still move the pieces in his favor? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 偽りのクラスメイト
The False Classmate
Die falsche Klassenkameradin
Le faux camarade de classe
Un`Infiltrata In Classe
A colega de classe mentirosa
Meluojanti Klasiokė
เพื่อนร่วมชั้นตัวปลอม
Itsuwari no Classmate
episode.summary: After confronting Prince Clovis, Lelouch learns information about his mother’s murder. Back at school, he is surprised to find that one of the terrorists he worked with is a fellow classmate. But when he confronts her, he finds the limits of his new power. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: その名はゼロ
His Name Is Zero
Sein Name ist Zero
Son nom est Zero
Il Suo Nome è Zero
O nome é Zero
Jo Vardas Zero
นามนั้นคือซีโร่
Sono Na wa Zero
episode.summary: Suzaku is accused of the murder of Prince Clovis, and Lelouch must save him. But to do so could mean revealing himself to the army. With a new alter ego and the help of Kallen and her comrade, they must try to pull off a daring and public rescue. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: コードギアス: 緊急ナビニュース
Code Geass: Emergency Navi News
Code Geass: Kinkyuu Navi News
皇女 と 魔女
The Princess and the Witch
Die Prinzessin und die Hexe
La Princesse et la Sorcière
La Principessa e La Strega
A princesa e a bruxa
Princesė Ir Ragana
Koujo to Majo
episode.summary: The mysterious green-haired girl known as C.C. is alive and intent on hanging around Lelouch as he accepted the contract and the Geass Power. Meanwhile, Suzaku is set free and encounters a strange girl who calls herself Euphie. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 奪われた 仮面
The Stolen Mask
Die gestohlene Maske
Le masque dérobé
Il Furto Della Maschera
